name: Thala Beach Lodge

reviews.text: This is the perfect place to destress- and to lose a few kilos! We needed to take a well earned break away from the work and stress of the city- and were looking to be active and lose a few accumulated kilos as well. The lovely hilly location with walks down to (and back up) from the long beach was a perfect way to start the day. Even better was the highly informative tour of the coconut plantation with tastings included. Yum! Thanks to Carl we learned about the health and weight benefits of coconut.Carl was most accomodating in assisting guests to de-husk their own coconuts. Not so difficult when you know how! After the tour which the whole group appeared to enjoy immensly we were promptly delivered a supply of husked coconuts to our room- these were perfect to take with us on the road for our drive to the Mossman Gorge- as the coconut water is the perfect re-hydrater or sports drink- full of natural electrolytes! We can highly recommend this resort and the tour- and we're definately making coconuts a part of our rhealthy diet.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Thala during our honeymoon and it was the highlight of our entire trip. The location is incredible - right in the forest with a beach steps away, beautiful pools, etc. and the accomodations are so private, comfortable and well maintained. The staff is beyond helpful - they took care of everything we needed - highly professional. We ended up staying an extra night we loved it so much. Perfect, perfect, perfect- I would not change one thing about Thala and would return again in a heartbeat.

reviews.text: We checked in the day before our wedding and instantly felt like we were on our honeymoon - the service and welcome we recieved as soon as we walked up the stairs to the reception desk was absolutley fantastic. We were then taken to the Curlews room for a welcome drink where we met Johan (the general manager) to go through details of our wedding day. Everything was taken care of by Johan and the team and we instantly felt very relaxed and safe in the knowledge that everything was going to run smoothly on our wedding day. Once we finished our drinks and closed our jaws ( the scenery is the best we had seen and we were in Australia for a month - this place is absolutely beautiful ) we were taken to our room.

description: Located on a private beach nestled in 145 acres of native forest, family-owned Thala is a five star eco and nature resort near Port Douglas. Sitting spectacularly atop a headland with breathtaking vistas, it provides an island-feel holiday from the mainland and is the perfect base to explore the Great Barrier Reef and Daintree Rainforest. Boutique timber bungalows are built high on stilts and nestle in the forest canopy, featuring either ocean or forest views. The views from the restaurant are panoramic across the mountains and coastline. Guests dine among the birds in the surrounding treetops enjoying modern Australian cuisine with friendly service. Osprey’s Restaurant is open to the public 7 days a week for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks.Paths meander through rainforests onto private sandy beaches placing guests in an unsurpassed secluded, relaxing environment. Complimentary guided onsite tours include a unique coconut odyssey, stargazing, nature walks and bird watching tours.
